text: Bill Barr is preparing to provide Congress with the “principal conclusions” of the Mueller report as early as Sunday.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Mueller has long had an eye for details. In the SF U.S. attorney's office, he appointed a "font czar” after one prosecutor sent a letter in italics. “He had me go out and find what fonts were used by different law firms,” the onetime czar told @byrontau.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Bill Barr’s chief of staff called the White House around 4:40 today to announce the Mueller report was in. Barr left the building less than three hours later. Great tic-toc on the day from @sgurman @kristinapet.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Since Mueller’s appointment in May 2017, Trump has tweeted the term “witch hunt” 178 times—an average of about once every four days.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Rudy Giuliani says Trump’s legal team is *not* demanding Barr give them an early look at the report before it’s released to the public. “It’s up to DOJ and confident it will be handled properly,” he says in a text message.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Mueller's team has already told its story of an aggressive Russian campaign to upend the 2016 election in a series of indictments and court documents. @aviswanatha and the @WSJgraphics team  have the timeline:
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: With Trump at Mar-a-Lago this weekend: White House counsel Pat Cipollone and White House special counsel Emmet Flood. The White House hasn’t decided yet whether to request a copy of the Mueller report from Barr.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: NEWS: Mueller is not recommending any further indictments, a senior Justice Department official says.  https://www.wsj.com/articles/house-committee-told-to-expect-word-that-mueller-report-has-been-delivered-to-attorney-general-barr-11553288563 …
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: The White House has not yet decided whether to request a copy of the Mueller report from Barr, per a source.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: The Mueller investigation may be over—but it leaves in its wake about a dozen other probes into Trump and his associates by an array of federal, state and congressional investigators. @nicole_hong and I break them down:
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: The White House says it has NOT received or been briefed on the Mueller report.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Mueller submitted his completed report to the attorney general one year, 10 months and six days after Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein appointed him to investigate Russian interference in the 2016 election. https://www.wsj.com/articles/house-committee-told-to-expect-word-that-mueller-report-has-been-delivered-to-attorney-general-barr-11553288563?shareToken=st2910a9221f4a447181fd9a19cf257ba6 …
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: MORE: Bill Barr has told Congress that he may advise them of Mueller's conclusions "as soon as this weekend." https://www.wsj.com/articles/house-committee-told-to-expect-word-that-mueller-report-has-been-delivered-to-attorney-general-barr-11553288563 …
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: MUELLER has completed the Russia investigation and submitted his report to Attorney General Bill Barr. https://www.wsj.com/articles/house-committee-told-to-expect-word-that-mueller-report-has-been-delivered-to-attorney-general-barr-11553288563?mod=breakingnews …
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: NEWS on @WSJ: House Judiciary Committee has been told to expect notification by 5 p.m. that the Mueller report has been delivered to the attorney general. via @dnvolz
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: The White House explanation on why Trump decided to reverse North Korea-related sanctions the Treasury Department announced today: “President Trump likes Chairman Kim and he doesn’t think these sanctions will be necessary.”—@PressSec
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Robert Khuzami, the federal prosecutor in Manhattan who supervised the criminal case against Michael Cohen, is stepping down at the end of the month.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: “Barring legal prosecution, what are the requirements of rehabilitation and redemption? ... Is there a place for a person in public service after being involved in scandal and abuse? In short, is there life after disgrace?”
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Brown University’s fundraising office facilitates one-on-one meetings between faculty and certain prospective students, according to emails reviewed by @the_herald, a practice that faculty members suggest favors wealthy and well-connected students.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Colin Kaepernick and Eric Reid will get less than $10 million to settle grievances with the NFL, according to people briefed on the deal.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Trump said today the U.S. would recognize Israel’s sovereignty of the long-disputed Golan Heights between Israel and Syria, among the contested factors in previous attempts to achieve Middle East peace. Netanyahu set to visit Washington next week.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text:
Kushner’s lawyer told the Oversight Cmte that Kushner used WhatsApp for official business, including corresponding w/people outside the U.S. 

WSJ has reported that Kushner corresponded with MBS over WhatsApp, which irked some national security officials.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: The House Oversight Cmte told the White House today that it has obtained evidence that White House officials—including Jared Kushner, Ivanka Trump, Steve Bannon and K.T. McFarland—used private email accounts or messaging apps to conduct official business. https://www.wsj.com/articles/house-democrats-probe-white-house-officials-email-use-11553188033?shareToken=st1bc8046276c24b7e9672ebd26ebf187f …
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Senators came to McCain’s defense after Trump said of the deceased senator: “I have to be honest, I’ve never liked him much.”
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: New Zealand to ban military-style semiautomatic weapons and assault rifles
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: This is on top of the 80+ document requests the Judiciary Committee sent out earlier this month, including to Michael Cohen and Trump lawyer Jay Sekulow. The committee has already received tens of thousands of pages in response to those requests, it said earlier this week.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: NEWS: The House Judiciary Committee is planning a second wave of document requests to Trump associates, including Rudy Giuliani, former Cohen lawyer Steve Ryan, Rex Tillerson and Gary Cohn. Requests expected to focus on pardon talks & emoluments. w/@dnvolz
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Two years after China began mass detentions of the mostly Muslim Uighurs, the sweeping assimilation drive has moved to a new stage: demolishing their neighborhoods and purging their culture.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Trump says his administration is discussing leaving tariffs in place on Chinese goods for a “substantial period of time.”
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: what
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: The Trump administration plans to stop detaining some migrant families who illegally cross the border in Texas's Rio Grande Valley and will release them instead, depending on how much room there is in ICE detention facilities.  @acaldwellwsj
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: The White House is expected to announce as soon as later today that it is nominating Steve Dickson, a former Delta official, as permanent head of the FAA, replacing acting chief Daniel Elwell.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text:
Nadler says Judiciary “has reason to believe” Trump contacted Whitaker to discuss some of those matters soon after Cohen’s guilty pleas.

WSJ reported that the cmte has evidence that Trump asked Whitaker if Berman could regain control of the Cohen probe.
https://www.wsj.com/articles/house-investigators-probe-trump-contact-with-matthew-whitaker-11551144842 …
author: rebeccaballhaus

text:
Nadler, in letter to DOJ, asks whether Trump & Whitaker ever discussed the Cohen probe, Trump’s implication in Cohen’s guilty plea, the firing of a U.S. attorney or the recusal of Manhattan U.S. attorney Geoff Berman, whose office ran the Cohen probe. 
https://judiciary.house.gov/sites/democrats.judiciary.house.gov/files/documents/3.19.2019%20Letter%20to%20Engel.pdf …
author: rebeccaballhaus

text:
SDNY said the Cohen raid was in part b/c they hadn’t been able to get Cohen’s Trump Org emails. 

In April court docs, SDNY said Cohen had objected to Mueller's request for those emails & that Mueller decided not to seek them at that time. h/t @nicole_hong
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Bolsonaro in today’s news conference: "May I say that Brazil and the U.S. stand side-by-side in their efforts to ensure liberty and respect for traditional family lifestyles with respect to God … and against politically correct attitudes and against fake news."
author: rebeccaballhaus

text:
Trump in the Rose Garden with Bolsonaro: “I’m very proud to hear the president use the term 'fake news.’”

Bolsonaro has repeatedly criticized the media as “fake news” and has emulated Trump in other ways, including communicating with voters largely via Twitter.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Trump said today he supported granting Brazil NATO privileges and backed the country's effort to join the OECD—something Brazil was hoping for but hadn't expected to make significant progress on during the visit, @WSJ reported yesterday. w/@louiseradnofsky
author: rebeccaballhaus

text:
By late 2017, Mueller was probing Michael Cohen for crimes including bank fraud & money laundering.

It wasn't until Feb 2018—when Mueller referred parts of the probe to SDNY—that investigators obtained evidence that Cohen violated campaign-finance laws. https://www.wsj.com/articles/investigators-obtained-michael-cohens-personal-emails-as-early-as-july-2017-11553003987?shareToken=st1082895f6e5c43c1968de5a3f19032a0 …
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Florida prosecutors have offered to drop charges against Bob Kraft and a number of other men charged with soliciting prostitution, according to a person familiar with the matter—if the men admit they would have been proven guilty at trial. https://www.wsj.com/articles/florida-prosecutors-offer-to-drop-charges-against-patriots-owner-robert-kraft-11553014972?shareToken=st4961e25852f5454bb5c429b5998fa130 … @andrewlbeaton
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Trump went after McCain again in his meeting with Bolsonaro just now, saying he remains “very unhappy” with the late senator over his vote on the health law. “I was never a fan of John McCain and I never will be,” he said, per @louiseradnofsky.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: In today's newly unsealed Michael Cohen court records: Confirmation that AT&T hired Cohen in 2017 to consult on issues including its merger with Time Warner. Other issues included net neutrality & tax reform. https://www.wsj.com/articles/investigators-obtained-michael-cohens-personal-emails-as-early-as-july-2017-11553003987 …
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Trump Calls Husband of Adviser Kellyanne Conway a ’Total Loser’
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Federal investigators working for Mueller had obtained search warrants for Michael Cohen's personal Gmail account in July 2017, earlier than previously known, according to new documents unsealed today.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: In light of the recent gov't investigation, AMI’s general counsel inserted an unusual provision into the contract w/Michael Sanchez making clear the deal wasn’t a “catch & kill”—if AMI didn’t publish anything in a month, he could sell it to another outlet.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: NEW from @mrothfeld @joe_palazzolo: How did the National Enquirer get Bezos’s texts? Michael Sanchez, the brother of Bezos’ lover, sold them for $200,000 to the National Enquirer’s publisher. https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-the-national-enquirer-got-bezos-texts-it-paid-200-000-to-his-lovers-brother-11552953981?shareToken=st1cddb8c9c72740a681ff04f3346ff977 …
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Nadler says the House Judiciary Committee has already received “tens of thousands” of documents in response to the letters it sent to 81 Trump associates & agencies, which set today as the deadline for a response.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Federal authorities raided Elliott Broidy’s office last summer, seeking records related to his dealings with foreign officials and Trump administration associates, according to a sealed search warrant obtained by ProPublica.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: "CHRISTCHURCH, New Zealand—The sharp cracks of gunfire were so confusing that at first the imam continued his sermon on forgiveness and brotherhood."
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: The Department of Transportation is investigating the Federal Aviation Administration’s approval of Boeing Co.’s 737 MAX jetliners, an unusual inquiry into potential lapses in federal safety approvals for new aircraft.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Trump, asked if he sees white nationalism as a growing threat around the world: “I don’t really. I think it’s a small group of people."
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Trump in the Oval Office says ICE officials “take such abuse” and that they’re getting more equipment, including more dogs. “There’s nothing that replaces a good dog,” he said, per pool.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text:
Trump issues the first veto of his presidency, calling the resolution passed by Congress "dangerous" and "reckless." 

"Congress has the freedom to pass this resolution, and I have the duty to veto it."
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: The Pentagon failed to deliver on a promise by acting Defense Secretary Pat Shanahan to provide senators with a list of military construction projects that stand to be affected by Trump’s national emergency declaration, prompting criticism from lawmakers.
author: rebeccaballhaus

text: Just in: Trump’s inaugural committee, under investigation by SDNY and two AGs, is filing a six-month extension on its 990 tax filing. “Our organization remains committed to meeting its legal and reporting obligations as it concludes its wind-down activities,” PIC spox says.
author: rebeccaballhaus
